info.name: Cerebellum, lateral zone
info.description: The lateral zone of the cerebellum makes up the largest part of the cerebellum and projects to the dentate nucleus.  It is thought to be involved in the planning and programming of learned, skilled movements movements, such as playing the piano or typing.  Since it is part of a major neural circuit with the motor and premotor cerebral cortex [motor/premotor cortex to corticopontocerebellar tract to contralateral cerebellar cortex to dentate nucleus to contralateral ventral lateral and ventral anterior thalamus and back to motor/premotor cerebral cortex] it is thought that it may act by influencing the motor and premotor cortex.
